# Repository Metadata Guide

This document contains recommended settings and keywords for maximizing the discoverability and organization of this repository on GitHub.

## Recommended GitHub Topics

To add these topics to your repository:
1. Go to your repository on GitHub
2. Click "About" (gear icon) in the top right
3. Add the following topics in the "Topics" field:

### Primary Topics
```
arduino
iot
hardware
embedded
piezo-sensor
relay-control
stage-lighting
drum-trigger
music-technology
interactive-art
```

### Technology Topics
```
cpp
arduino-uno
arduino-nano
pwm
sensors
relay-module
sound-sensor
120v-relay
```

### Application Topics
```
diy
maker
open-hardware
live-performance
music-visualization
drum-kit
cymbal-trigger
light-show
performance-art
```

### Category Topics
```
hackaday
maker-faire
electronics-project
arduino-project
home-automation
```

## Repository Description

Set your repository description (on GitHub's "About" section) to:

```
ü•Åüí° Arduino-based drum trigger system that lights up 120V bulbs when you hit a ride cymbal. Uses piezo sensors and relays for real-time stage lighting synchronized with drumming.
```

## Repository Website

If you have a project website, demo video, or blog post, add it to the "Website" field in the "About" section.

Example:
```
https://youtu.be/your-demo-video
```

## Repository Settings

### Recommended Settings

**Features to Enable:**
- [x] Issues
- [x] Projects (optional, for tracking roadmap)
- [x] Wiki (optional, for extended documentation)
- [x] Discussions (recommended for Q&A and community)

**Social Preview Image:**
Consider adding a social preview image (1280x640px) showing:
- Your drum setup with the lights
- Circuit diagram overlay
- Project logo/branding

Upload via: Settings ‚Üí Options ‚Üí Social preview

### GitHub Discussions Categories

If you enable Discussions, create these categories:
1. **Q&A** - Questions about setup and troubleshooting
2. **Show and Tell** - Share your builds and modifications
3. **Ideas** - Suggestions for improvements
4. **Hardware Builds** - Discuss hardware variations and upgrades
5. **General** - Everything else

## Open Graph Metadata

For better social media sharing, ensure your README has:
- [x] Clear project title
- [x] Embedded demo video/image
- [x] Concise description
- [x] Visual badges

## Search Keywords

Your project should be discoverable when people search for:
- "Arduino drum trigger"
- "DIY stage lighting"
- "Piezo sensor relay"
- "Cymbal triggered lights"
- "Arduino music visualization"
- "Drum MIDI trigger alternative"
- "Interactive lighting system"
- "Arduino 120V relay control"

## README Keywords

Ensure these terms appear naturally in your README:
- Arduino, piezo sensor, relay module, drum trigger
- Stage lighting, live performance, music technology
- DIY, maker, open source hardware
- PWM control, debouncing, threshold calibration
- 120V AC, safety, electrical isolation

## Additional Metadata Files

Consider adding:
- `.gitattributes` - Already exists ‚úì
- `.editorconfig` - For consistent code formatting
- `keywords.txt` - Arduino library keywords (if converting to library)
- `library.properties` - If converting to Arduino library format

## SEO Tips

1. Use descriptive commit messages
2. Reference issues in commits (`Fixes #123`)
3. Keep README updated with keywords
4. Add alt text to images
5. Use semantic HTML in README where applicable
6. Link to related projects and tutorials

## Related Projects to Link

Consider adding a "Similar Projects" or "Inspiration" section linking to:
- Arduino MIDI drum triggers
- DMX lighting controllers
- Piezo sensor tutorials
- Stage lighting DIY projects
- Music visualization projects

This creates a network effect and helps people discover related work.
